io.spine.server.model

Class AbstractHandlerMethod<T,M extends com.google.protobuf.Message,C extends io.spine.type.MessageClass<M>,E extends io.spine.core.MessageEnvelope<?,?,?>,R extends MethodResult>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.model.AbstractHandlerMethod<T,M,C,E,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the target object
    M - the type of the message handled by this method
    C - the type of the message class
    E - the type of message envelopes, in which the messages to handle are wrapped
    R - the type of the method invocation result
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    HandlerMethod<T,C,E,R>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommandAcceptingMethod, CommandReactionMethod, EventApplier, EventHandlerMethod, SubscriberMethod

    @Immutable
public abstract class AbstractHandlerMethod<T,M extends com.google.protobuf.Message,C extends io.spine.type.MessageClass<M>,E extends io.spine.core.MessageEnvelope<?,?,?>,R extends MethodResult>
extends java.lang.Object
implements HandlerMethod<T,C,E,R>
    An abstract base for wrappers over methods handling messages.

    Two message handlers are equivalent when they refer to the same method on the same object (not class).

      • discoverAttributes

        @PostConstruct
public final void discoverAttributes()

        Initializes attributes by obtaining values via functions provided by attributeSuppliers().

        Specified by:
        discoverAttributes in interface HandlerMethod<T,C extends io.spine.type.MessageClass<M>,E extends io.spine.core.MessageEnvelope<?,?,?>,R extends MethodResult>
        See Also:
        attributeSuppliers()

      • attributeSuppliers

        @OverridingMethodsMustInvokeSuper
protected java.util.Set<java.util.function.Function<java.lang.reflect.Method,MethodAttribute<?>>> attributeSuppliers()
        Obtains a set of functions for getting method attributes by a raw method value.

        Default implementation returns a one-element set for obtaining ExternalAttribute.

        Overriding classes must return a set which is a union of the set provided by this method and the one needed by the overriding class.

      • rawMessageClass

        protected java.lang.Class<? extends M> rawMessageClass()

      • getFirstParamType

        protected static <M extends com.google.protobuf.Message> java.lang.Class<M> getFirstParamType(java.lang.reflect.Method handler)
        Returns the class of the first parameter of the passed handler method object.

        It is expected that the first parameter of the passed method is always of a class implementing Message.

        Parameters:
        handler - the method object to take first parameter type from
        Returns:
        the class of the first method parameter
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the first parameter isn't a class implementing Message

      • checkAttributesMatch

        protected void checkAttributesMatch(E envelope)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Allows to make sure that the passed envelope matches the annotation attributes of a method.

        Default implementation does nothing. Descending classes may override for checking the match.

        Parameters:
        envelope - the envelope with the massed to handle
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the default implementation does not throw ever. Descending classes would throw if the annotation arguments do not match the message of the passed envelope.

      • toResult

        protected abstract R toResult(T target,
                              java.lang.Object rawMethodOutput)
        Converts the output of the raw method call to the result object.

      • getFullName

        public java.lang.String getFullName()
        Returns a full name of the handler method.

        The full name consists of a fully qualified class name of the target object and the method name separated with a dot character.

        Returns:
        full name of the subscriber
